lexUnit.name: whine.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give or make a whine.

sentence.text: It whined every second it was here . "
The dog whined a protest as Sharpe rode away .
It was night when I became aware of the dogs whining somewhere and called them .
The two dogs were whining softly in the back of their throats and sniffing the air as if distressed .
He whined anxiously , and came into the part of the room where they all were , and lay down under the table .
The engines whined softly as beautiful Oriental stewardesses showed them to their seats in First Class and offered them complimentary champagne , which they both refused .
An hour later , Lalage came tip-toeing into her room where she heard a dog whining gently .
A radio whined somewhere .
The two microphones skilfully fitted into the lectern whined disconcertingly for a few moments .
And that part of my mind seemed to whine faintly and go very cold and still .
It vanished completely as Alec opened the door for her and she stood on the threshold , looking into the dark , listening to the wind whining away outside the house .
We 're sitting round a real fire burning logs , and a fan heater 's whining away in the centre of the room 's dark , threadbare carpet .
They may whine and cry ; sputter about everything ; not know what they want and are never satisfied , capriciously rejecting the things they have just asked for and such a temper .
As infants they cry or scream , as toddlers they whine or have tantrums , as older children or teenagers they learn to quarrel , argue , sulk and make hurtful remarks .
In the corner by the stove Rosie whined and pulled against her chain .
A tram whined and groaned past and the door closed again .
The tram whined and sparked as it pulled up at the fare stage near the Dennistoun Palais and Whitehill Street .
Babies , sweaty and overheated , were whining and fractious .
Machinery above whined and the elevator jolted to a halt , causing him to shift footing .
The dog was whining and wanting out at you . "
Yes , you whine and you wring your hands , but then you go back and make the same mistakes .
Outside , the lift began to whine as someone summoned it .
The motors whined as she put the speeder into reverse .
With its motor whining in protest , the transporter started to crawl along the corridor .
It was so high up , it whined like a fly .
It reversed fast , the gearbox whining like a violin , and parked in front of the Mercedes .
The insects buzzed , whined , hummed , stridulated and droned as the air grew warmer in the sunset .
The cop shrugged , his shoulder servos whining .
In the kitchen , Douglas spoke in a low voice to Domino , and the dog whined .
It is usual for young puppies to whine to attract their mother 's attention .
